subject: RE: [junit] Re: Test Grouping/Partitioning
msgSnippet: ... One feature of our product is a user provisioning API.  That is a set of stored procedures which act as a language-independent interface to the database of
messageBody:
> Why do you need to run all the database tests, but not, say,
> all the slow tests? or all the tests? Did you really need to
> run all the database tests, or do they happen to be a
> convenient subset of the slow tests? What prompted you to
> partition the tests by "database", rather than "slow" or
> "needs configuration"?

One feature of our product is a user provisioning API. That is a set of
stored procedures which act as a language-independent interface to the
database of user information. I needed to run just those tests to make
sure that the user provisioning system hadn't broken. There are lots of
other slow tests, but I only wanted those that exercise the database.


Todd.
